| 1                | John Smith                 | Acme Corp.                | CEO                               | Internal           | Supporter       | High   | High      | High       | High    | Accurate, timely data; high-level overview of key HR metrics; ability to identify areas for improvement.             | Regular executive briefings, presentations at board meetings, key performance indicator (KPI) reports.          | Email updates, monthly executive summary reports.                                        |
| 2                | Jane Doe                   | Acme Corp.                | Chief HR Officer (CHRO)          | Internal           | Supporter       | High   | High      | High       | High    | User-friendly interface; actionable insights; data integration with existing HR systems; robust reporting capabilities. | Regular project status updates, demos, feedback sessions, joint decision-making on design choices.             | Weekly project update meetings, email communication for urgent matters.                      |
| 3                | David Lee                  | Acme Corp.                | HR Director - Operations         | Internal           | Supporter       | Medium | High      | Medium     | Medium  | Access to relevant data for their department; clear visualization of key metrics; ease of use for reporting.        | Regular training sessions, user manuals, quick start guides, access to support channels.                       | Online training materials, email support, user forum.                                        |
| 4                | Sarah Jones                | Acme Corp.                | HR Director - Talent Management | Internal           | Supporter       | Medium | High      | Medium     | Medium  | Data-driven insights for talent acquisition and development strategies; seamless integration with talent management systems. | Regular presentations showcasing relevant data, feedback sessions on dashboard features.                      | Email updates, data visualizations.                                                     |
| 5                | Michael Brown              | Acme Corp.                | IT Director                   | Internal           | Supporter       | High   | Medium    | High       | High    | System reliability, security, scalability, and integration with existing IT infrastructure.                         | Regular technical discussions, joint planning for system implementation and maintenance.                    | Technical documentation, email for urgent issues, scheduled meetings.                          |
| 6                | Emily Wilson               | External Consulting Firm | Data Analyst                   | External           | Neutral         | Medium | Medium    | Medium     | Medium  | Accurate and reliable data; clear data definitions; timely delivery of the project.                                | Regular project status updates, discussions about data quality and analysis.                                 | Email communication, project status reports.                                                |
| 7                | Employees                  | Acme Corp.                | Employees                   | Internal           | Neutral         | Low    | Low       | Low        | Low     | (Indirect impact)  Positive employee experience, fair and transparent HR practices.                                  | Focus on overall employee experience and communication around benefits of the dashboard (post-launch).         | Company-wide announcements, intranet updates.                                                |
| 8                | Industry Benchmarking Data Providers | Various                   | Data Providers                 | External           | Supporter       | Low    | High      | Low        | Low     | Accurate and reliable benchmarking data, timely delivery.                                                            | Contractual agreements, regular communication regarding data updates.                               | Email communication, data delivery reports.                                                |


**Notes:**

* Power:  High (Significant influence on project decisions), Medium (Moderate influence), Low (Limited influence).
* Interest: High (Actively involved and concerned), Medium (Some interest), Low (Little interest).
* Influence: High (Ability to sway project outcomes), Medium (Moderate influence), Low (Limited influence).
* Impact: High (Significant impact on project success), Medium (Moderate impact), Low (Limited impact).

This Stakeholder Register will be reviewed and updated regularly throughout the project lifecycle to reflect changes in stakeholder involvement and influence.  This is a living document and should be updated as the project progresses and new information emerges.
